vulnerabilities.title: browserify-sign upper bound check issue in `dsaVerify` leads to a signature forgery attack
vulnerabilities.description:
### Summary
An upper bound check issue in `dsaVerify` function allows an attacker to construct signatures that can be successfully verified by any public key, thus leading to a signature forgery attack.

### Details
In `dsaVerify` function, it checks whether the value of the signature is legal by calling function `checkValue`, namely, whether `r` and `s` are both in the interval `[1, q - 1]`. However, the second line of the `checkValue` function wrongly checks the upper bound of the passed param
